title: (x) The Shawshank Redemption - Wade Sans {James Gareth}
content:
Evening everyone,   
   
Wondering what font was used for the Shawshank Redemption movie poster. Thanks for any info.   
   
 ![Shawshank Redemption Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051721im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24973.gif)

 [‹ (x) Markham Script [or] Markham 602 - Bingham Script {Mike F}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051721/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2808 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) GQ magazine fonts - HTF Gotham, FB Miller, Gridnik {Karl, Peter Henderson (self)} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051721/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2862 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alyce

comments.content: I think it may be Wade Sans that's compressed a bit.

Here's Wade Light compressed (I eyed it). The spacing is way off but it gives you a rough idea.   
   
 ![Wade Sans Light Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051721im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24978.jpg)

James, Thank you, this is so great... I typed in my question and relaxed for the rest of the evening. And in the morning I have my answer. My theory of "design elves" has finally been validated.   
   
Thanks also for going the extra step to create and post a sample. I appreciate it. Alyce

_My theory of "design elves" has finally been validated._   
Now _THAT_ would explain the pointy ears... ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051721im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)   
Nice going Jamie!
